cards.evo_description: The crystals' power is eternal. In comparison, our chance meeting is but a sigh which clouds the frozen air before dispersing. Even so... perhaps this fleeting warmth has meaning. Perhaps it is something I need.

cards.evo_description: Young Treants are bad at expressing themselves. But I understand what they mean. H-hey, what? Are those termites? Eeeww, get away!

cards.evo_description: Something is strange about this forest. Today I fired an arrow at a most curious insect, and to my surprise, it deflected it! It was my first encounter with a bug sporting a metallic carapace. —Forest Notes, Part 1

cards.evo_description: Here in this forest, things like social status and political power are more worthless than weeds. Even if I put an extra hole in the head of some noble who broke the law, no one would criticize me. I can't think of a better place to work.

Steel-covered insects, beasts clad in steel—the forest elves have but one explanation: the fauna have adopted machinery into their biology. One suspects we will soon follow suit.
—On Flourishing, Part 1

Mom told me to leave it in the forest, but she's not the boss of me! This bug's way too cool! I'm totally taking it home with me!

He did promise to take good care of it. Boys will be boys, I guess. But I draw the line when a pet is literally bigger than the house!

He doesn't eat or sleep. I reckon he's the perfect lookout; he ain't a bad shot, either. Don't waste your time feelin' sorry for trespassers—this town's prosperity comes from the ranch, after all.

cards.evo_description: I cannot storm the stronghold by myself. That much is certainly true. But I am not alone! My friends are waiting for me inside, and their fragrance shall lead me to them!

A branch that flourishes is no more worthy than one that withers. It merely is. You must view reality as it exists.

Music descends from on high, covering the city of Crystalia like a blanket of snow. Only she knows the magic spell to put a smile on everyone's face.

cards.evo_description: Whew! I'm glad you're one of the good ones! If you were a bad guy, you would've been shot to bits! How do I know that? Well, the arrows fired from a daisybow never miss an evil person.

cards.evo_description: I am without equal, a lord of new techniques that rival even a thousand strong. The logic behind these twin blades is foolproof—twice the weaponry, twice the fallen foes. Even the world beyond the forest will come to know my power.

cards.evo_description: Answering the young man's cries, the God Tree made a kaleidoscopic protection bloom from the elf's outreached hand. And just as the gentle elf promised, the fairies guided the young man onward. —Prostrations before the God Tree, Chapter 3

What terror, what fright—the great tree seen by night.
Eyes, mouth, and nose—yet silent it grows.
Mouth closed in daylight hours—once opened, devours.
—Woodland folk song
cards.evo_description:
The great tree is the forest's most fearsome terror.
Possessed of eyes, nose, and mouth, still it may not speak.
That wordless mouth opens only to devour its prey.
—Songs of the Unsullied Wood (Translation)

cards.description:
Lovely, lovely lady of the wood.
Drinks the lives of mortals and looks the way they should.
Enter not the forest, lest this fate you meet:
Eternity as soil beneath her shining feet.
—Woodland folk song
cards.evo_description:
This woodland spirit is lovely to behold.
Her beautiful mien mimics those she has absorbed.
Seated atop the graves of intruders, she shines with purest light.
—Songs of the Unsullied Wood (Translation)

cards.description:
Prideful, prideful god of all that grows.
Creation's dawn is in its whorls—the secrets it knows.
Die and fall beneath its till—become one with the past.
To be the future's soil is the only way to last.
—Woodland folk song
cards.evo_description:
The embodiment of a forest's growth is prideful in nature.
It is an avatar of the world's inception.
It ushers all life toward the dead past, tilling it into the future's soil.
—Songs of the Unsullied Wood (Translation)

The sprout bears a sapling, bringing further blessings to the land. The oathbearer trains herself to grow strong, so that she might protect this bounty of nature.
—Teachings of the Great Forest, Part 2
cards.evo_description:
The sapling extends its branches, spreading the blessings of nature along with them. If any should seek to plunder this bounty, the mighty warrior must use her strength to eliminate them.
—Teachings of the Great Forest, Part 3

The branches beget leaves, bringing a wealth of blessings. When the time comes, the mighty warrior ushers in those who have shown gratitude for the forest's bounty.
—Teachings of the Great Forest, Part 4

When the leaves flourish and the sapling evolves into a great tree, it drops new seeds to the ground. The guardian guides her sistren, nurturing them to become mighty warriors themselves.
—Teachings of the Great Forest, Part 5

cards.description:
The iron harvested from beetle horns has made our weapons far more efficient. Metal is more durable and malleable than wood. Though accepting these changes gives me pause—when will we ourselves have to adapt?
—Forest Elf's Journal, Part 2
cards.evo_description:
It is for the forest's sake that they've donned steel and brandished machinery. Though they have changed, the land has not. And they know it, as they find their ancestral home growing... outdated.
—On Flourishing, Part 2

cards.evo_description: Early bloomer, late bloomer; we all get second winds. You, on the other hand, are going to wilt while the forest explodes in color.

cards.evo_description: A lot of folks are leaving their trash in the forest. Tsk-tsk. But on the flip side, there are so many kindhearted friends of the forest! Thank you for your hard work, everybody!

Yup yup, I'm small and that's A-OK! At least, that's what my gut tells me. It's also telling me this is the right way to go!
...Whoopsie. It was a dead end.
cards.evo_description: With one whack of my teensy-weensy mallet, I go from fun-sized to serious-sized! Now that my instincts are working properly, let's see... All right, we're supposed to go the opposite direction! I just know it!

cards.description: From an outsider's point of view, you may suspect that I am a caster of curses. This is not the case. I am merely an agent of karma.
cards.evo_description: What is the difference, you ask? Curses are used by humans to inflict pain on each other. Karma is simply the will of the forest, exacting judgment on humans for their wrongdoings.

Tootle-too! Tootle-tootle-too! Tweedle-deedle-doo! Toot-toot-tootle!
Nice.
cards.evo_description:
"And away we go! Make sure ya don't hold Mim back with all yer hot air!"
"You're one to talk. Make sure you don't get stuck in a rut and trip her up."
—A Certain Stump and Horn

cards.description: People in my hometown would often say I remind them of a cat. They'd ask me to do my "usual thing." Um... What's my "usual thing," you say? Well... It's... talking like a cat... meow.
cards.evo_description: I always wanted to see the world beyond my home, but when I actually did, there was so much that took me by surprise. For example, people don't normally scale cliffs or climb trees, right? Then... does that mean gifting someone with something I've hunted is also not normal?

He said there's no point in becoming a forest guardian and left the embrace of the wood. Foul-mouthed as he is, I thought he was a good child at heart. Perhaps I was wrong...
—Forest Elder
cards.evo_description:
I heard rumors on the wind of an elf swordsman who destroyed a bandit base. So, that boy left the forest to nip the threat in the bud.
—Forest Elder

cards.evo_description: The whispers of the fairies are meant to be taken with a dose of caution: sometimes they lead you down the wrong path entirely. After all, I'm human myself, and fairies love to play.

Hey! Where are you going with my leaf?!
—Leaf Man

cards.evo_description: Wait. You say you can eat these tough fruits? What did you call them again? Parts? And you don't eat them, you use them for up... grades? Hmm. I don't get it, but if there are this many sprouting everywhere, that means you can stay with us for a long time, huh?

cards.description: The archer journeys in search of her other half. Though her yearning is marred by jealousy, her heart retains its kindness. It is that which makes her fit to lead and receive the goddess's blessing. With greensong in her heart and justice to guide her bow, she forges ahead.
cards.evo_description: I know I'm weak... I overthink and worry about things a lot. But if I give up without even trying, then I won't be able to save anyone. That's why hope is so important—it's what keeps me going even in the darkest times. And my hope is in my heart and my friends!

cards.evo_description: By the time the elf's hand closed around the staff, it was too late. The carnivorous flowers' bait had successfully lured another victim to their fate.

I have to say, I'm disappointed. That sweet naivety of yours is holding you back. But don't worry—I can fix that for you. Run rampant until everything has melted away... Noxious Elf!

"I'm gonna win this!" "Nuh-uh! The flower crown is mine!"
But the fairy who'd suggested the race lay down for a nap.

"I couldn't gather a single flower! You two are amazing!"
"Yay, we won!" "Here! Take our flowers as a consolation prize!"
The sleeping fairy got her flowers, all according to plan.

"Wow, Lena! There's actually someone with a sharper tongue than you!"
"Excuse me? Have you looked in a mirror, Lina?"
"Our words..." "...say the opposite of what we mean!"
—Lina & Lena, Twin Souls

cards.evo_description: The forest's breath imbues him with strength, healing the ravaging pains of age. His life is not his own, for he is a steward. The trial overcome, the forest swells with the song of victory. "My blade shall reach ever-loftier heights."

—Lila, Arborist

I'm pleased to see everything was to your liking! The innkeeper is well known for her cooking around these parts, actually... Your pajamas are right over here, so feel free to change while we prepare your bedding!

"Nnngh, you two're too cute! I dunno what I'd do without you."
"Squeee! Reeeeally?" "We'll stay with you forever!"
cards.evo_description:
The blade he wields is a sword of forest royalty—a symbol of their adoration.
"Ah, another fan of mine?"
"Swooooon!" "We love you, our one and only prince!"

cards.evo_description:
Oh dear... That map was over fifty years old, wasn't it... Will that girl be okay?
—Village Elder

cards.evo_description: Once listless and lazy, the creature scuffles about no longer. It leaps to the crown of the sacred tree, a perch that may have been granted to this newly blessed forest familiar. It very well may be a position that the squirrel snatched for itself, however.

cards.evo_description: Another day, another bountiful harvest! I may not be able to grow these babies, but I sure know how to sell 'em! Keeping my customers' mouths watering and my pocketbook lined—that's two birds with one stone!

cards.description: Welcome to our kingdom, dear traveler! Please allow me to utilize my royal elven guiding skills to show you around. I trust that the spirits who watch over these lands will welcome you as well... Probably. Yes, I'm sure they will!
cards.evo_description: I've mastered countless elven skills and enchantments, and yet... I still cannot see the spirits. I must persevere! I know that I will be able to see them someday!

cards.description:
I had a child. An only child, cut from the same cloth as his father. Stern-looking, but sweet and pleasant once you got him talking. I can't retire... not until I've taught him the way of the forest—and how to survive.
—Den of Winds: Memories of a Convict, Part 3
cards.evo_description:
Once, a group of rowdy upstarts tried to stage a coup. How many of those fools my son and I cut down, I can't quite recall... But I do remember the thrill. It was as if I was fighting side by side with my husband again.
—Den of Winds: Memories of a Convict, Part 4

After watching Subaru battle, all my children are raring to go as well! I think Seventh Flame is a wonderful club!
—Fuwari Hahajima
cards.evo_description:
Hehe. Maybe the members of Seventh Flame will actually get Haruma to change his ways?
—Fuwari Hahajima

cards.description:
Things were going smoothly—especially after I set my son up to become a lieutenant in the Ring. Unfortunately, some people weren't all too happy with me—I had chosen to kill our great advisor, after all.
—Den of Winds: Memories of a Convict, Part 5
cards.evo_description:
Our "advisor" was an ancient talking tree—a symbol of the history of the Verdant Ring. To cut it down was to spit in the face of tradition... An act akin to patricide. I began to hear whispering—that I'd gone mad with power.
—Den of Winds: Memories of a Convict, Part 6

cards.description: When the Verdant Ring was founded, our ancestors bid me to grow it further, that I may "better slaughter our enemies." To be treated liked a beast was a fate I couldn't permit for my son... And so I filled the tree with my Crimson Incense, blotting out all life within.
cards.evo_description: I'll do whatever it takes to ensure my son succeeds me as leader. Denizens of this steel forest, fight with me, or flee—it does not matter. But if you choose battle, prepare to scatter and fall, for all that awaits us is the aromatic sleep of death.

cards.evo_description: Feels great to have perfect weather like this, huh? You know, life's not so bad all the time. After I take a nap, I always feel chipper and raring to go! Here—a blessing to guarantee sound sleep! Just a little present from your "partner in naptime," hehe.

cards.description:
One time, a guest helped us cook, and I'll never forget the doofy grin on my sis's face when she dug into the chicken. Ever since, I've been working on a recipe to bring tourists back to our sleepy little town.
—Vitherwood School of Agriculture, Term 303 Applicant
cards.evo_description:
Agriculture and culinary science were the perfect combo. Her Resplendent Roast Chicken was an instant hit with kids and won the Imperial Cookoff ten years straight, attracting gourmet tourists from far and wide.
—Vitherwood Alum Spotlight #3

cards.description: Hmph. Don't get me wrong, human. I didn't save you because we're friends. Losing a proficient smith would be a loss, that's all. Where else in the world would I find gear that fits my needs so well? Do you know how hard it would be to find a replacement?!
cards.evo_description: Look at the solid craftsmanship of this blade! It's well-balanced and cuts like a dream! I hate to admit it, but I'd take man-made steel over elven-wood gear any day of the week! Damn it, human... I may not like you, but I can't be mad at your work!

cards.description: Those blasted fairies said a blind archer could hit a target with more accuracy than me. Fools. As if I don't also have a sword. They wouldn't be in this bloody mess if they hadn't gotten on my bad side.
cards.evo_description: It's far more efficient to use fairies than to befriend them. After all, not only is it easier to use them as a tool, it's less aggravating too. Now, be a good target and let me test the sharpness of my blade.

You've become very good at crafting lucky talismans, Kyrie. Your presence really lights up the room—everyone smiles more when you're around. I just hope we can continue to live together peacefully...

cards.evo_description: It is not only the fruits of the land that are consumed by this carnivorous plant. Humans and other creatures caught within its vines are all gobbled up without mercy.

cards.evo_description: The forest that was there yesterday had vanished overnight. Gazing at the tracks on the ground, I muttered to myself, "The forest lives." —The Living Forest, Chapter 1

cards.evo_description: Sure, being in the forest is safe, but it's no fun! No matter where you walk, all you see is green. So that's why I think there's a bright future waiting for me outside somewhere!

cards.description: He is a young boy who wanders the forest, void of memory. Although his vision is clear, he is a shadow of his former self.
cards.evo_description: In the rustling of the forest, the boy is burdened by whispers of the fairies, which remind him of his terrible past. These whispers serve as a warning and a curse. He can't escape his sins...

cards.evo_description: This forest has always protected and watched over me, so I gotta do my best too! My hand is steady—here goes! In the name of the forest, I'll shoot this arrow!

cards.evo_description: I did it! I finally hit the mark! Now you'll get a taste of my skill! Wait, I'm out of arrows? What am I supposed to do now?

cards.description: Iiiit's showtime! Hey, I know how I look, but the forest is my lovely baby! You mess with the woods, you get felled! Understand?
cards.evo_description: Iiiit's showtime! I may seem kinda rowdy, but don't judge me by my looks! I'm everybody's lovely baby! I'll trash anyone who troubles the trees! Understand?

cards.description: Outsiders continue throwing their broken machines into the forest, the place I call home. I will gladly take it upon myself to collect their trash, for you see, here in the forest we help each other out.
cards.evo_description: Now, where to put the parts I've collected? Should I just attach them to the junk I found yesterday? If anyone finds out how much I enjoy fiddling with these metallic creations, it'll be the end of me. Sigh... And yet my heart's always aflutter when I'm tinkering around.

cards.evo_description: Oh. My. God. That girl is soooo gorgeous! She's just, like, radiating beauty. I hate her. Like, so much that I could just foam at the mouth... Grr...

cards.evo_description: Your cocoon's impressively novel, but novelty isn't everything. Fruit's tastiest, after all, just before it goes soft. —Mechaclaw Elf to Robotic Bagworm

cards.description: Long ago there was a sickly boy who fell in love with a fairy. The fairy granted him protection, but a pestilence spread throughout his land as a result. The boy's eyes came to burn with hatred and rage for her.
cards.evo_description: You insist you never intended to destroy the land? It was an unfortunate coincidence? What a terrible joke! Even if that's the truth—it's too late now. I despise you. What else are you good for than this?

cards.evo_description: My sins, my errors are what nourished the hatred within you. I didn't act out of love. It was a selfish infatuation I simply forced upon you. But I care deeply for you. There's nothing more to it.

Lightning Plowshares is a fascinating technique. The practitioner gathers incredible lightning power around one hand, and then strikes, tilling the soil like the heavens' own plow!
—The mysterious Masked Scholar

cards.description: Long ago, when the greatest tree in the forest was but a sapling, he reached the pinnacle of fairy swordsmanship. Now, that sapling has long overshadowed the woods. He is still improving—each dawn reaching for loftier heights than existed the day before.
cards.evo_description: Just as a tree's rings evidence the sturdiness of its trunk, the fairy blader's wrinkles are proof of his resolute strength. Much like a great tree's branches, the pinnacle of fairy swordsmanship is ever rising skyward. He hones his techniques now with as much diligence as ever.

cards.description: Glittering. Ephemeral, fragile, and strong. That is the nature of the forest's lifeblood, the resplendence that I command! Now, I beseech that same eternal vitality—lend power to my sword!
cards.evo_description: The misery of the trees, the anger of the flowers, everything is a demand of the Queen. And why I must press forth with the forest at my back! O enemies of the weald, you will know the woodborne wrath of my blade!

cards.description:
Ice crystals are pure. They reflect a person's true colors. The wicked will simply freeze. But for those who are true of heart...
"You're... an interesting one. Here, I'll lend you a hand."
cards.evo_description:
She, too, is pure. As she changes company, so do her colors shift. Before villains, she turns pale with rage. But before the like-hearted, she sparkles with radiance.
"Crystalia's light guide us!"

cards.evo_description: Whoa! I didn't think this would happen during my night patrol! The fairies are spinning the squirrels' acorns like tops! Kinda mean, don't you think?

cards.description: These crimson-colored leaves may be beautiful, but they also speak of hard times to come. You who would invade our home, turn back now. Otherwise, the light will leave your eyes before the next leaf falls to the ground. You won't feel a thing.
cards.evo_description: My brethren, this is where we make our stand, shoulder to shoulder like the trees of our beloved forest. Be not afraid. Let us shine bright in one last symphony of color before winter claims us!

cards.description: The forest is governed by its own set of rules. Unruly ivy, you shall not grow here. If you encroach upon the flowers, then by the forest's decree, I will be forced to prune you.
cards.evo_description: The forest is unforgiving, sometimes plucking the life of those who walk beneath its canopies. Foul ivy, I will rip you from the earth and use you as traps, for even those punished by the wood are given new purpose—that is the law of the forest keeper.

cards.description:
The fairy swung a stick and sent an acorn flying my way. If I caught it, she cheered; if I dropped it, she jeered. It was a strange experience... Was she playing some sort of fairy trick on me?
—A Perplexed Traveler
cards.evo_description:
"Wow, I didn't think you could keep up with all those hits! You're good!" —Fairy Slugger
"Nom, nom. Another excellent acorn. Her swings aren't bad, either." "We ought to sign her before another team gets to her." —Fairy Teammates

cards.description: What hideous, awful bargain bin did you crawl out of? I don't know if apocalypse chic is in where you're from, but your outfit gets a big fat nope from me! Why, oh, why am I doomed to live in this tragic fashion wasteland?
cards.evo_description: This world is such an haute mess. Clearly it's up to me to make it haute couture! Let's see, how about some florals to start? There, you look much less tragic already! Once I'm through with you, you'll be burning that trash heap you call clothes! Ngwah-ha-ha-ha-ha!

cards.skill_disc: Fanfare and Last Words: Put a Naterran Great Tree into your hand.

cards.description: The metallic ivy that popped up turned out to be a blessin', eh? There's definitely enough to keep you and the others going; I'll pass the word on to Mánagarmr to keep an eye out too. Even if the ivy's not going anywhere, it can't hurt to know where it grows.
cards.evo_description: What did you say you used to track prey? A con-pew-tur? Thanks to your help, there'll be plenty to eat! C'mon, everyone! Let's make this a right proper feast!

cards.description: Deprived of his senses, the intruder's life begins flashing before his eyes. He recalls a childhood spent burning anthills and plucking the wings off flies. Or was he the one being killed? "No... No! I'm not a bug... I'm human!" —Intruder's Last Words
cards.evo_description: Like a dried leaf, the intruder falls to the ground. The sage blinks, shaking off memories. He recalls feeling helpless rage as his home burnt, as his wings were torn. "How bold of you to think that your life is worth more than an insect’s." —Feyfolk Sage

cards.evo_description: Anyone who messes with these woods will be buried under the fey tree. Don't worry, I've got this! I’m a genius among racoon mages—protecting the forest and my friends is as easy as leaf pie! "Rump-a-thump!"

cards.evo_description: No roads lead to eternity, but life still struggles to find a way. Providence, however, is not on your side. Tremble, for you will soon meet your end. The Trial of Unkilling shall spare none, but if you let yourself perish now, your soul shall live on.

I'll forever rue the day I decided to visit this damned forest. Two days and still no sign of an exit—Wait! That light... H-hey! Wait for me!
—Ancient Bamboo Inn, I
cards.evo_description:
Not all souls are fortunate enough to stumble upon our humble inn. Feel free to drop in for a day, or spend the night here if you wish.

cards.description:
Glub... glub... The surface of the water faded into obscurity as the man sunk into the depths below. "There shall be no drowning here—not on my watch."
The young man, once wrought with despair, was returned to the surface. "Blessings of the spring upon you, child."
cards.evo_description: He eventually became a farmer, married, and the pain he had once suffered subsided. He returned to the spring to leave an offering of fruit as gratitude for its blessing. As he was leaving, a familiar yet gentle laugh could be heard, along with the crunch of an apple.

cards.description:
Glub... glub... As the man's conscience faded, a voice rippled through the spring. "It'd be a real waste to drown on a such lovely afternoon."
He woke on the banks, cleansed of his woes. "Well? C'mon, the water's nice and refreshing!"
cards.evo_description:
The man became a regular visitor of the spring. "You practically live here! ...Not that I would mind."
A warm light bathed the spring as the two smiled. "Enough of that—let's play! I won't lose the splash fight this time, you hear?!"

The weary man couldn't believe what he was seeing. The tanuki asked once again, "You look like you could use some quality time with Mother Nature. How about it?"
A hallucination? Regardless, he felt an incredible urge to seek out the nearest forest.

cards.description: Did you just call me "difficult"? Whatever. I don't expect you to understand. My friends from out of town get me... They also have a low tolerance for big oafs who buzz around shouting out pointless orders.
cards.evo_description: Y-you actually get me? It's so rare to find someone on the same wavelength... Wanna meet my friends? We usually hang out in the forest; it's such a relief not having to put up with mindless drones.

cards.description: Though his heart may break, Owl Man will keep going. With each breath, he fights valiantly for the forest, metamorphosing into something greater than the sum of his parts.
cards.evo_description:
He is the marvel of the forest.
He is the hope of the forest.
He is... Brightplume Owl Man.

cards.description: The home I knew before is no more. From the day I was charmed by the fey, I became one with the forest. I pledge everything to it—my body, my soul, all my possessions—and I would not have it any other way.
cards.evo_description: The fairies charmed me, but the feeling was mutual. Our hearts and minds are inextricably linked; we would do anything for each other. Ah, how fortunate I am, that I can experience love in its purest form.

cards.description: Forests, villages—blah, blah, blah. Useless distinctions, really! From up above, everything is connected! How about it, partner? You up for a quick flight over the woods and towns? There's big money to be made!
cards.evo_description:
"Welcome—oh, if it isn't my airborne business rival."
"Well, I'm sure as heck not going to walk everywhere! Flying's faster—keeps the produce fresh! Anyway, I'll have one bag. Don't worry, I'll keep to my terrority."
—A Chat with the Forest Merchant

cards.evo_description: Pro tip: If you're hunting, make your kill in the forest. Seize any chance to go for the jugular. Once you've got them by the tail, never let go until you've achieved your objective.

cards.evo_description: A tiny spark of malice can cause a great deal of trouble. He lures travelers astray and sends gales to obscure their paths. See him conspiring with the woodland sprites—he is the very figure of malevolence.

cards.description:
When the forest expands, it propagates like raging billows on the sea, unstoppable. If any should attempt to hinder its growth, the mighty warriors will thwart their endeavors.
—Teachings of the Great Forest, Part 8
cards.evo_description:
When the forest has burgeoned to cover the entire land, it becomes the world itself. Those hoping to join the ranks of mighty warriors are ushered in from far and wide.
—Teachings of the Great Forest, Part 9

cards.description:
Elven weaponry has assumed new forms, with further enhancement expected. Take this glider—it can wrap the user in wind while blasting away foes. Such a machine is proof that we elves have surpassed our earthly origin.
—Forest Elf's Journal, Part 3
cards.evo_description:
The forest dwellers increased their firepower with machinery. However, this conflicted with the old ways, so they made a decision: to embrace change, to cull those who still obeyed the land.
—On Flourishing, Part 3

cards.evo_description: While he is often lost in thought, he would never lose his way in the woods. From underbrush to canopy, the forest is his refuge. He is an elusive philosopher, evading confrontation whenever he can.

cards.evo_description: When the forest seems inescapable, reach out and take her hand. She ferries trailblazers on her boat pulled by fairies. Service with a smile: that's the motto of an elf who's always looking toward the future.

cards.description:
Oh, he's so cool and handsome. But is it true he used to be a ruffian? Well... This town was poor and desolate in the beginning. Look at him now, though—a respected hunter. Just seeing him in action makes me want to swoon!
—Saloon Waitress, Jessop Town
cards.evo_description:
This town used to be nothin' but sand and rocks. We had cattle, but they attracted some nasty critters. Enter the hunters. As the town grew, so did the jobs. It's because of the ranch that town and hunter both got a fresh start.
—Saloon Doorman, Jessop Town

cards.description: When the petals fall from this tree, parting will follow soon after, or so the old legend went. But the nearby villagers treated the tree with such respect and kindness that it grew weary of inflicting such grief on them. Ever since, it has stayed in bloom all year round.
cards.evo_description: Rumors of the tree spread, and people flocked from afar to see it. The tree bent its branches so that its flowers could be better seen, and young lovers would keep petals as good luck charms. In time, the villagers became prosperous, and the tree delighted in their happiness.

cards.evo_description: My dear ones, seeing you thrive is the greatest reward I could ever ask for. Alas, I cannot make your burdens any lighter, but I can at least encourage you to persevere. Things will get better.

cards.description: I'm good at finding things. No matter how small a clue is, my eyes can track anything down. And once a target's in my sight, I always strike true. I am the dark huntress... and there's nowhere you can run from me.
cards.evo_description: I'm hunting a certain quarry; a monster with power that can rival even my own. My eyes have landed on you, but tell me—what is it you see when you look at me?

cards.description: How dare you let a breath of life violate my paradise. Let my miasma carry on the wind and infect you. I don't want you to simply wither; I want you to rot and desecrate everything around you. Yes, grovel like the diseased maggot you are.
cards.evo_description: Your life force is anathema to me. Let my miasma sap the vile warmth from your bones; let the flies nest in your cold corpse. Now go forth as my messenger—carry disease on the wind and erode the verdant force from the very roots of the world.

cards.evo_description: Just as the elk's elaborate horns are designed to attract partners, so too have humans devised fashionable displays to attract the objects of their desire. Love is indeed a battlefield for elk and human alike.

cards.description:
"The forest's, like, really bouncing back."
The once-blighted verdure grows, reaching for the sun.
"It warms my heart. That's all the reason I need to protect it."
She hugs her family, cocooning them in pure affection.
cards.evo_description: "My speech processors are having a difficult time parsing your words..." Everyone has a role to play in the forest. "But I do get the gist of it. Yes, this is heartwarming, isn’t it?" Hers is to make sure that anyone who threatens her loved ones is sent packing.

"What's the plan, girlies?"
"First, we shove acorns up their nose like this!"
"Then we lure 'em into the swamp!"
—Fairy Pathfinder and Her Fairy Friends

When I play Shadowverse, I want to become something special—and shine on a stage of my very own!
Spring forth, Brilliant Fairy!

cards.evo_description: It's thanks to my comrades that I can do my duty as a sniper. I'm not good at making friends, but they've always been there for me. The least I can do is ensure that their hands stay clean.

cards.evo_description: I love beauty in general, but lovely people are really something else. And what's better than beautiful people forming a beautiful friendship? But unpretty things? No, thank you. They don't belong in my world.

cards.description: The spirits of spring and summer were sad to see one of them go when it was their turn. The spirits of autumn and winter proposed a solution—a way for the four spirits to stay together. And so the four seasons took on a new form within the body of a tree, turning it into a titan.
cards.evo_description: As the seasons continued to roam as one within the titan, elements of nature began to crumble. Blizzards, heatwaves, typhoons, and floods—seasons fell into disorder as the flora and fauna struggled to keep up.

In days past, those who entered the wood would never be seen again. The strix's appearance changed that, and disappearances dropped dramatically. Today, the festival celebrated in the bird's honor is a must-see sight.
—World Forest Guidebook, Chapter 5: Lost Woods
cards.evo_description:
Cripes, today is the day of the annual festival, isn't it? The procession must have already made its way out of the woods... taking my hopes of emerging from here with them...
—Traveler Lost in the Wayward Wood

cards.description: Of lilies, white symbolizes purity, and orange resplendence. Rooted beneath her sable garden is a seething resentment. Those who trample her realm are scourged with an affliction most terrible. "Thou art lower than a seedling... Thou shalt wither and rot."
cards.evo_description: Of lilies, pink symbolizes vanity, and yellow mirth. Black lilies have no need of such overgrown frivolity. Their petals are not meant to be admired. None can escape the curse that flows forth from their roots. "A healthy blossom you will not become. Wither beneath my boot."

cards.description: This treant was once an uprooted sapling. With plenty of water and tender care, it grew into a magnificent tree, which now guards the community. Despite its appearance, it is a gentle giant—when children cry upon seeing its fierce visage, its branches droop in sadness.
cards.evo_description: Though large in frame, this treant is meek and timid. However, its desire to protect the community that raised it is strong, and its shyness becomes fierceness when faced with those who would do its loved ones harm.

cards.description:
Huh? There's no one here, but I hear a voice... What? You're dead and trying to come back to life? Huh. Okay, then! Me and Bobo'll lend a hand!
—Abby, A Hero's Tale, Pt. 2
cards.evo_description:
Even though you're dead, I can hear your voice whispering to us, lending us your strength. You really are kind... So I'll do what I do best and chop down the bad guys! We'll get you back, no matter what it takes!
—Abby, A Hero's Tale, Pt. 2

cards.evo_description: Anyone that hurts Mim better prepare to be pickin' out splinters from unmentionable places! Come at me with yer sharpest axe! Here I go! I'll show ya I ain't stumpin' around!

cards.description: Heed my warning, trespasser. We have no mercy for those who threaten the princess.
cards.evo_description: If you turn back now, I can promise your safety. If you draw your blade, I can only promise an icy grave.

cards.evo_description: The forest's been cleansed of that evil miasma thanks to the pixies who live there. We should go and share the good news with the ones who evacuated!

cards.evo_description: Master of the forest, defender of the weak, principled thief—Robin Hood is all things to all men. Proud and passionate, this outlaw will not put down the bow while the flames of the struggle continue to blaze within.

cards.description: Though flowers scatter, their scent remains. That lingering fragrance is a precious, soothing balm to me. I long to greet the blooms again next season, and that is why I cannot fall!
cards.evo_description: A flower's beauty lies in its transience. The more we mourn their fading, the more pathos we feel. I must cull the weeds before the next season comes. I wonder what scent you'll leave behind as you're severed from your stem!

These plants are just what I was looking for—perfect for my research. This forest will provide me with all the materials I need to rise to the top!
—Field Notes of an Ambitious Young Researcher
cards.evo_description:
I was careless... There were horns hidden amongst the branches, barbs that sap the life from anything they touch. I thought I was gaining something from the forest when it was the one taking from... me...
—Last Words of a Once Ambitious Young Researcher

cards.evo_description: You've been rolling around in the dirt again, haven't you? Come on, let's get you cleaned up. Oh dear, what would you do without me?

cards.description:
To her, the forest is sacred.
To him, the forest is home.
They don't need words.
A common enemy unites them.
cards.evo_description:
The forest created her.
The forest birthed him.
They don't need words.
Love for their mother unites them.

cards.description: We must never kill. Though a single tree may be felled to preserve the forest, we must not end its life by our own hand. Abide by the teachings and protect the greater dignity of life.
cards.evo_description: The Ten Omens were bestowed upon the world on a tablet of sapphire stone. Upon the trials' completion, the stone crumbled, but devoted disciples of unkilling returned to the forest, to nurture their seeds of belief.

cards.description: Though the fox is a master of illusions, its majesty is a genuine blessing from the sacred tree. Take heed: though its actions seem without rhyme or reason, they are the will of the forest itself—and what they portend, mere mortals cannot know.
cards.evo_description: The forest bewitched the fox—or is it the other way around? The power of the verdant orbs lies firmly within its four paws. Are its actions the forest's will, or a fox's fickle fancy? Alas, mere mortals will never know.

cards.description: Elves have an affinity with nature—they harmonize with it, and by so doing, manipulate its flow. But the art of a dark elf is grander by far! Beasts of the wood, heed my words! Succumb to my melody and do my bidding! Hahahahaa!
cards.evo_description:
Uh, well... my dad wasn't always like that. I think it's kind of my fault for being prickly with him all the time. Eurgh... I hate to say it, but that front he puts up... I do the same thing to protect myself!
—Rayne, Divine Smith

cards.evo_description: A mage seeks the spirits' blessing for personal gain. An elementalist seeks the spirits' power to protect Mother Nature herself. Who is to say to whom the spirits will lend their strength?

cards.evo_description: With the aid of the trees and the wind, he became expertly versed in the spearmanship of the forest. Having firmly laid his roots in his new woodland home, there were no longer any who would dare call him an outsider.

now I aint never ben gud at sckool but our crops aint growin and cheif says he rekons its the dirt gon bad. I wanna lern howta fix the feild up. shes all ways ben gud too us.

The Father of Farmland developed the art of soil enchantment right here at Vitherwood! His tireless work to revitalize local agriculture has inspired students for centuries, and is the base of modern charm-farming.
—Vitherwood Alum Spotlight #1

It's a walking guillotine, for lack of a better name. Nothing is safe from its blades. Not trees, not the earth, and of course, not necks. The condemned have only to wait their turn.

Watch how the blades dance through the air. The first slash slices in two, and the second dices indiscriminately. Take a seat. Tremble while you still can. The execution is about to begin.
—Waiting for the End, Epilogue

cards.evo_description: Inside him is reason: a desire for an unchanging order and absolute obedience. Those who oppose him are sinners, doomed to be ravaged by his arrows. The time to evade atonement has run out—One arrow will rain down devastation a thousand times over.

Shadowverse taught me that I didn't have to change. I can walk the path of my own choosing; that's my strength! Waltz with fangs of purest white! Dance, Cosmos Fang!

cards.description: See the roses blooming? The deep red petals beckon to you. Such an intoxicating color. Can the pulsing crimson within you resist? Even knowing the thorns will wound you, you still come. How sad you are.
cards.evo_description: See us grow so beautifully, proud, and unhindered? We only want to be beautiful—and if you would mar us, expect no mercy. I'll teach you that you have no right to pluck a flower that grows only to be beautiful.

cards.description: A lupine god referred to as the sage of the forest. This beast provided wisdom to an ancient dragon, which knew only how to rule tyrannically, and conveyed orders to protect the forest.
cards.evo_description: A lupine god who confronts intruders from the outside world. Until the guardian dragon awakens, the wolf will lead the woodland forces against all who would disrupt the forest's harmony.

cards.description: It suddenly appeared in the darkest depths of the forest and silently began its inexorable invasion of the surrounding land. The sounds of the trees fracturing and splintering before it were almost like screams.
cards.evo_description: From deep within its own insides, it dragged out a great and terrible spear. With a bellow that shook the trees to their very roots, it proclaimed the end of the forest.

cards.description: It was the soft crunch of a bear's footsteps. The hunter's practiced ears recognized it as he retreated into the shadows. A bear is to be left alone. That is, if it was a bear, of course.
cards.evo_description: It certainly was the crunch of a bear's footsteps. However, its eyes gleam with the shrewdness of a bird of prey. Whether in the dead of night or light of day, those eyes astutely take their next target.

cards.description:
The hornet queen lounges on her throne, the power of ten thousand drones loosely grasped in her idle hands.
"Ah, I'm so bored. Can't I just dissolve it all?"
With but a twitch of those sticky fingers, she could end the world by sundown.
cards.evo_description:
Sticky with nectar, the hornet queen sprawls over her throne and yawns.
"Ah, so sleepy... Maybe I'll dissolve the world tomorrow."
She sleeps, and the world sees another dawn.

cards.description: Contained within the Vajano Marsh is a murky pool, as fetid as it is deep. Below the surface of this abyss is where the mad lord of the forest resides. Those who enter his waters become his playthings, and whether they walk away or drown, it's purely his whim.
cards.evo_description: When did his reign begin, and how long will it last? A lord lost forever to isolation, he searches for a companion. If he should ever hear the telltale signs of a plaything escaping beyond his grasp, the resulting howl would rattle the surrounding woodlands.

cards.description: Life is a famished beast ravening for nourishment. That is why the law exists. The forest law supports life, like the sturdy trunk of a tree. You must understand that freedom is but a sweet poison.
cards.evo_description: The law is as ivy, as thorns. It is troublesome to be bound by, painful to be stuck by. But if you are to live in this forest, it cannot be avoided. You must understand that freedom is but a sweet poison.

cards.description: Such insolence and impudence. You must learn respect, for without it, all is chaos. Roots and weeds that do not know their place grow wild in anarchic fervor... Why do you not see, the path you seek to carve out is barren? I, Wimael, will punish this sullied sinner.
cards.evo_description: Let the winds teach you the meaning of respect. Prostrate yourself in penance for your shameful deeds. The aromatic gale will batter away at you, till you are wilted. To erase the odor of the one most foul, a punishment in Redolence seems apt.

The forest is merciful and amiable—its generosity welcomes all forms of life. However, sometimes such kindness takes after foolishness.

—Stolen Verdant, Chapter 10

cards.description:
A flower blooms, wilts, and, given enough time, sprouts anew. Why? Because the earth remembers that flower. So we, too, are born, die, travel through the memories of the earth, and are reborn.
—Oral Traditions of the Forest
cards.evo_description: Scouts and monsters thought to be dead returned as an attacking mob. I remain unaware of the cause or mechanism of their return, a failure in my research. But I am calling off this experiment. That forest ... is too unsettling. —Research notes regarding a certain forest

cards.description: A whisper on the wind tells me of a threat to the forest. Now is the time for us to put all our training to use and defend our home. Follow me to victory! Float like a butterfly, sting like— Hey, where did everybody go?!
cards.evo_description:
"You're flying too fast, I can't keep up!"
"Forget stinging like a bee, try waiting like a snail for once!"
—Fellow Fairies Left Behind

cards.description: The life of the forest is etched into the ancient mammoth's tusks. Alas, history is older than even the mammoth, and it soon overwhelms the prodigious creature. The weight of history causes its horns and, in turn, its very nature to twist.
cards.evo_description: The mammoth pulverizes the nourishing earth under its feet. The flora and fauna it once lived in harmony with are trampled like enemy hordes. The unbroken circle of life sustaining the forest is now a twisted spiral of destruction.

cards.description: He sits upon his throne, watching over all creation. From an elder tree, a seed floats into his palm. The king watches his children grow, nurtured by a verdant lullaby—a millennium a mere instant in the forest's life.
cards.evo_description: He looks upon his children with unbridled delight. Should anyone dare to pluck their small lives, he is ready to mete brutal justice. The forest responds to his righteous anger—the leaves cut like knives, the ground trembles, and his wings are dyed in crimson.

cards.description: Those who possess language bring forth something from nothing. Through conversation, negotiation, and resolution, the something is given a name. However those who do not possess language return the something to nothing through howling, mauling, and destroying.
cards.evo_description: Humans are animals that developed through language. They are therefore powerless against those who cannot speak. This creature's roars burst eardrums, and his assault rends flesh. Man can do nothing but fear the coming of nature's purge.

cards.description: I have led a life unwithering—burgeoning, as it were. This way of being is the core of existence. Therefore fear not ruin; one must merely endure eternity. Now, shall we put the world to trial?
cards.evo_description: Pass through the gates of heaven or plunge into the abyss of hell, you will suffer. Your tears will burn your cheeks; your screams will rend your throat. The world will continue, tormented by eternity and cursed with perpetuity. Now, shall we put the world to trial?

cards.description: The villagers found the spirit in a shadowed thicket, withered palms together in prayer. "W-water... Soil..." They pruned away the dark canopy and nursed the tree back to health. "Thank you. Thank you. Thank you."
cards.evo_description: The villagers found the spirit, basking in light, gnarled palms outstretched. "Water? Soil?" It had grown used to their mercy, to being hand-fed all it desired. "I hunger. I hunger. I HUNGER."

cards.description: Only the forest folk realize the land is asleep. But there's no soul, not even one connected to nature, who can predict what will happen when it awakens.
cards.evo_description:
To reject progress, to refuse change... It's akin to death. I will pierce through anything that aims to obstruct advancement. Whether that seems blasphemous or reckless, I care not—it's all the same to my drill.
—Damian, Drillarm Brawler
